cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba and 105 miles south of Long Island in the Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Bahamas then curving along the Florida east coast, tracking toward east-central Florida Thursday evening before continuing north toward Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near the east-central Florida coast (around Palm Beach to Cape Canaveral corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the Flagler/Volusia county line to Fernandina Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach to the Flagler/Volusia county line, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast from North Palm Beach through Cape Canaveral to Flagler/Volusia line, plus the Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) likely early Thursday with a significant (55%) chance of 50-kt winds and a smaller but rising risk of hurricane-force gusts as Matthew passes just offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft possible at and near Port Canaveral if peak surge coincides with high tide, with large battering waves and beach erosion.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches of rain, isolated totals near 10 inches, could produce localized freshwater flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents; minor coastal flooding outside surge peak; operations affected by heavy seas and reduced visibility.
